title: Seven Steps to Choosing a Limo Service
text_content:
1. Be sure the company holds a valid Virginia license.
In order to maintain a license, DMV requires all limo services to have liability insurance that covers passengers. You can find a licensed and registered limousine service in your locality by searching DMV's database ofLicensed Transportation Providers.
2. Ask for and check the service's references.
Determine if other customers have had complaints about the service. You may want to contact the following institutions:
3. Ask how the service screens its drivers.
You need to be assured that your driver will meet your expectations.
4. Be sure you are getting the specific limousine you want - and that it is safe.

6. Ask for a list of what the cost of the limousine covers.
Ask if there will be any additional - or hidden - charges for gratuities, mileage and fuel costs, vehicle cleaning, etc.
